column4: Tesla offers to buy solar panel maker SolarCity in deal up to $2.8 bln
column5: Elon Musk's Tesla Motors Inc said on Tuesday it has made an offer to acquire solar panel maker SolarCity Corp in an all-stock deal worth as much as $2.8 billion  as the electric car maker looks to get into the market for sustainable energy for homes and businesses.

column4: BRIEF-Solarcity says it intends to carefully evaluate Tesla offer
column5: * Says "intends to carefully evaluate proposal" from Tesla to buy the company  Source text for Eikon:  Further company coverage:    (Bengaluru Newsroom: +1-646-223-8780)

column4: BRIEF-Tesla offers to buy solar panel maker SolarCity
column5: * On June 21  2016 co approved making of preliminary all-stock proposal to board of directors of Solarcity Corporation

column4: Tesla offers to buy solar panel maker SolarCity
column5: June 21 Electric car maker Tesla Motors Inc  said it had made an offer to acquire solar panel maker SolarCity Corp in an all-stock deal.

column4: Chinese firm denies agreement with Tesla to build factory
column5: BEIJING A Shanghai company denied a report that its controlling shareholder signed a non-binding agreement with Tesla Motors Inc to build a factory in Shanghai  according to the firm's exchange filings.

column4: Chinese firm denies agreement with Tesla to build factory
column5: BEIJING  June 21 A Shanghai company denied a report that its controlling shareholder signed a non-binding agreement with Tesla Motors Inc to build a factory in Shanghai  according to the firm's exchange filings.
